Esto puede aumentar el rendimiento de la compilación al ignorar bibliotecas grandes.

trans-unit.source: Prints result as JSON or store it in a file
Prior to webpack 5 it was common to use:

Prior to webpack, front-end developers would use tools like grunt and gulp to process these assets and move them from their /src folder into their /dist or /build directory. The same idea was used for JavaScript modules, but tools like webpack will dynamically bundle all dependencies (creating what's known as a dependency graph). This is great because every module now explicitly states its dependencies and we'll avoid bundling modules that aren't in use.

Prior to webpack, front-end developers would use tools like grunt and gulp to process these assets and move them from their /src folder into their /dist or /build directory. The same idea was used for JavaScript modules, but tools like webpack will dynamically bundle all dependencies (creating what's known as a dependency graph). This is great because every module now explicitly states its dependencies and we'll avoid bundling modules that aren't in use.
trans-unit.target: Antes del paquete web, los desarrolladores front-end usaban herramientas como grunt y gulp para procesar estos activos y moverlos de su carpeta /src a su directorio /dist o /build . Se utilizó la misma idea para los módulos de JavaScript, pero herramientas como el paquete web agruparán dinámicamente todas las dependencias (creando lo que se conoce como un gráfico de dependencias ). Esto es genial porque cada módulo ahora establece explícitamente sus dependencias y evitaremos agrupar módulos que no estén en uso.

trans-unit.source: Progressive Web Application
trans-unit.target: Aplicación web progresiva

trans-unit.source: Progressive Web Applications (or PWAs) are web apps that deliver an experience similar to native applications. There are many things that can contribute to that. Of these, the most significant is the ability for an app to be able to function when offline. This is achieved through the use of a web technology called Service Workers.
trans-unit.target: Las aplicaciones web progresivas (o PWA) son aplicaciones web que brindan una experiencia similar a las aplicaciones nativas. Hay muchas cosas que pueden contribuir a eso. De estos, el más significativo es la capacidad de una aplicación para funcionar sin conexión . Esto se logra mediante el uso de una tecnología web llamada Service Workers .

trans-unit.source: Putting the content of helpers into each chunk will result into its code being downloaded twice. By using a separate chunk this will only happen once. We pay the cost of an additional request, which could be considered a tradeoff. That's why there is a minimum size of 30kb.
trans-unit.target: Si coloca el contenido de los helpers en cada fragmento, su código se descargará dos veces. Al usar un fragmento separado, esto solo sucederá una vez. Pagamos el costo de una solicitud adicional, que podría considerarse una compensación. Por eso hay un tamaño mínimo de 30 kb.

trans-unit.source: Recently, ts-loader has started to consume the internal TypeScript watch mode APIs which dramatically decreases the number of modules to be rebuilt on each iteration. This experimentalWatchApi shares the same logic as the normal TypeScript watch mode itself and is quite stable for development use. Turn on transpileOnly as well for truly fast incremental builds.
trans-unit.target: Recientemente, ts-loader ha comenzado a consumir las API internas del modo de vigilancia de TypeScript, lo que reduce drásticamente la cantidad de módulos que se reconstruirán en cada iteración. Este experimentalWatchApi comparte la misma lógica que el modo de reloj normal de TypeScript y es bastante estable para su uso en desarrollo. Activa transpileOnly también para compilaciones incrementales realmente rápidas.

trans-unit.source: Resolvers are created using the enhanced-resolve package. The Resolver class extends the tapable class and uses tapable to provide a few hooks. The enhanced-resolve package can be used directly to create new resolvers, however any compiler instance has a few resolver instances that can be tapped into.
trans-unit.target: enhanced-resolve se crean utilizando el paquete de resolución mejorada . La clase Resolver extiende la clase tapable y usa tapable para proporcionar algunos ganchos. El paquete de enhanced-resolve se puede usar directamente para crear nuevos resolutores, sin embargo, cualquier instancia de compiler tiene algunas instancias de resolutor que se pueden aprovechar.

trans-unit.source: Resolves the given request to a module, applies all configured loaders and calls back with the generated source, the sourceMap and the module instance (usually an instance of NormalModule). Use this function if you need to know the source code of another module to generate the result.
trans-unit.target: Resuelve la solicitud dada a un módulo, aplica todos los cargadores configurados y devuelve las llamadas con la fuente generada, el sourceMap y la instancia del módulo (generalmente una instancia de NormalModule ). Utilice esta función si necesita conocer el código fuente de otro módulo para generar el resultado.

Similarly, when implementing the HMR interface in a module, you can describe what should happen when the module is updated. However, in most cases, it's not mandatory to write HMR code in every module. If a module has no HMR handlers, the update bubbles up. This means that a single handler can update a complete module tree. If a single module from the tree is updated, the entire set of dependencies is reloaded.
trans-unit.target: Del mismo modo,cuando se implementa la interfaz de las HMR en un módulo,se puede describir lo que debe suceder cuando se actualiza el módulo.Sin embargo,en la mayoría de los casos,no es obligatorio escribir el código HMR en cada módulo.Si un módulo no tiene manejadores de HMR,la actualización se hace esperar.Esto significa que un solo manejador puede actualizar un árbol de módulos completo.Si se actualiza un solo módulo del árbol,se recarga todo el conjunto de dependencias.

trans-unit.source: So now you have a little bit of insight about how webpack works behind the scenes. "But, how does this affect me?", you might ask. The simple answer is that most of the time it doesn't. The runtime will do its thing, utilizing the manifest, and everything will appear to just magically work once your application hits the browser. However, if you decide to improve the performance of your projects by utilizing browser caching, this process will all of a sudden become an important thing to understand.

So now you have a little bit of insight about how webpack works behind the scenes. "But, how does this affect me?", you might ask. The simple answer is that most of the time it doesn't. The runtime will do its thing, utilizing the manifest, and everything will appear to just magically work once your application hits the browser. However, if you decide to improve your projects performance by utilizing browser caching, this process will all of a sudden become an important thing to understand.
trans-unit.target: Así que ahora tienes un poco de conocimiento sobre cómo funciona Webpack entre bastidores."Pero,¿cómo me afecta esto a mí?",se preguntarán.La respuesta simple es que la mayoría de las veces no lo hace.El tiempo de ejecución hará lo suyo,utilizando el manifiesto,y todo parecerá funcionar como por arte de magia una vez que tu aplicación llegue al navegador.Sin embargo,si decides mejorar el rendimiento de tus proyectos utilizando el caché del navegador,este proceso se convertirá de repente en algo importante de entender.

trans-unit.source: So we're using webpack to bundle our modular application which yields a deployable /dist directory. Once the contents of /dist have been deployed to a server, clients (typically browsers) will hit that server to grab the site and its assets. The last step can be time consuming, which is why browsers use a technique called caching. This allows sites to load faster with less unnecessary network traffic. However, it can also cause headaches when you need new code to be picked up.

So we're using webpack to bundle our modular application which yields a deployable /dist directory. Once the contents of /dist have been deployed to a server, clients (typically browsers) will hit that server to grab the site and its assets. The last step can be time consuming, which is why browsers use a technique called caching. This allows sites to load faster with less unnecessary network traffic, however it can also cause headaches when you need new code to be picked up.
trans-unit.target: Entonces estamos usando webpack para empaquetar nuestra aplicación modular que produce un directorio /dist desplegable . Una vez que el contenido de /dist se ha implementado en un servidor, los clientes (normalmente navegadores) accederán a ese servidor para capturar el sitio y sus activos. El último paso puede llevar mucho tiempo, razón por la cual los navegadores utilizan una técnica llamada almacenamiento en caché . Esto permite que los sitios se carguen más rápido con menos tráfico de red innecesario; sin embargo, también puede causar dolores de cabeza cuando se necesita recoger un código nuevo.

trans-unit.source: Technically, NODE_ENV is a system environment variable that Node.js exposes into running scripts. It is used by convention to determine dev-vs-prod behavior by server tools, build scripts, and client-side libraries. Contrary to expectations, process.env.NODE_ENV is not set to "production"within the build script webpack.config.js, see #2537. Thus, conditionals like process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production' ? '[name].[hash].bundle.js' : '[name].bundle.js' within webpack configurations do not work as expected.
trans-unit.target: Técnicamente, NODE_ENV es una variable de entorno del sistema que Node.js expone en scripts en ejecución. Se utiliza por convención para determinar el comportamiento dev-vs-prod mediante herramientas de servidor, scripts de creación y bibliotecas del lado del cliente. Contrariamente a lo esperado, process.env.NODE_ENV no está configurado como "production" dentro del script de compilación webpack.config.js , consulte el # 2537 . Por lo tanto, condicionales como process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production' ? '[name].[hash].bundle.js' : '[name].bundle.js' dentro de las configuraciones del paquete web no funciona como se esperaba.

trans-unit.source: Technically, NODE_ENV is a system environment variable that Node.js exposes into running scripts. It is used by convention to determine dev-vs-prod behavior by server tools, build scripts, and client-side libraries. Contrary to expectations, process.env.NODE_ENV is not set to 'production'within the build script webpack.config.js, see #2537. Thus, conditionals like process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production' ? '[name].[contenthash].bundle.js' : '[name].bundle.js' within webpack configurations do not work as expected.

Tells devServer to inject a Hot Module Replacement. Setting devServer.injectHot to true will result in always injecting. It is possible to provide a function to inject conditionally:
Tells devServer to inject a client. Setting devServer.injectClient to true will result in always injecting a client. It is possible to provide a function to inject conditionally:
Tells devServer to write generated assets to the disk. The output is written to the output.path directory.
Tells stats how many items of assets should be displayed (groups will be collapsed to fit this space).
Tells stats how many items of chunk modules should be displayed (groups will be collapsed to fit this space).
Tells stats how many items of modules should be displayed (groups will be collapsed to fit this space).
Tells stats how many items of nested modules should be displayed (groups will be collapsed to fit this space).
Tells stats to add IDs of modules and chunks.
Tells stats to add information about the reasons of why modules are included.
Tells stats to add information about the webpack version used.
Tells stats to add the source code of modules.
Tells stats to add the timing information.
Tells stats to add warnings.
Tells stats to display chunk parents, children and siblings.

Tells stats to exclude the matching assets information. This can be done with a string, a RegExp, a function that is getting the assets name as an argument and returns a boolean. stats.excludeAssets can be an array of any of the above.

Tells stats to exclude the matching modules information. This can be done with a string, a RegExp, a function that is getting the module's source as an argument and returns a boolean. stats.excludeModules can be an array of any of the above. stats.excludeModules's configuration is merged with the stats.exclude's configuration value.

Tells stats to exclude the warnings that are matching given filters. This can be done with a string, a RegExp, a function that is getting a warning as an argument and returns a boolean. stats.warningsFilter can be an array of any of the above.
Tells stats to include the debug information of the specified loggers such as Plugins or Loaders. When stats.logging is set to false, stats.loggingDebug option is ignored.
Tells stats to show dependencies and the origin of warnings/errors. stats.moduleTrace is available since webpack 2.5.0.
Tells stats to show performance hint when the file size exceeds performance.maxAssetSize.
Tells stats to show the outputPath.
Tells stats to show the publicPath.
Tells stats to show the exports of the modules.
Tells stats to sort the assets by a given field. All of the sorting fields are allowed to be used as values for stats.assetsSort. Use ! prefix in the value to reverse the sort order by a given field.
Tells stats to sort the chunks by a given field. All of the sorting fields are allowed to be used as values for stats.chunksSort. Use ! prefix in the value to reverse the sort order by a given field.

Tells stats to sort the modules by a given field. All of the sorting fields are allowed to be used as values for stats.modulesSort. Use ! prefix in the value to reverse the sort order by a given field.
Tells stats whether to add information about assets inside modules. Set stats.moduleAssets to false to hide it.
Tells stats whether to add information about assets that are related to other assets (like SourceMaps for assets).
Tells stats whether to add information about cached (not built) modules.
Tells stats whether to add information about runtime modules.
Tells stats whether to add information about the namedChunkGroups.
Tells stats whether to add information about the built modules to information about the chunk.
Tells stats whether to add information about the built modules.
Tells stats whether to add information about the cached assets. Setting stats.cachedAssets to false will tell stats to only show the emitted files (not the ones that were built).
Tells stats whether to add information about the cached modules (not the ones that were built).
Tells stats whether to add information about the children.
Tells stats whether to add information about the chunk. Setting stats.chunks to false results in a less verbose output.
Tells stats whether to add information about the hash of the compilation.
Tells stats whether to add information about the origins of chunks and chunk merging.
Tells stats whether to add logging output.
Tells stats whether to add the build date and the build time information. Set stats.builtAt to false to hide it.
Tells stats whether to add the details to the errors.
Tells stats whether to add the details to the errors. It defaults to 'auto' which will show error details when there're only 2 or less errors.
Tells stats whether to display the --env information.
Tells stats whether to display the distance from the entry point for each module.
Tells stats whether to display the entry points with the corresponding bundles.
Tells stats whether to display the errors.
Tells stats whether to group assets by how their are related to chunks.
Tells stats whether to group assets by their asset info (immutable, development, hotModuleReplacement, etc).
Tells stats whether to group assets by their status (emitted, compared for emit or cached).
Tells stats whether to group modules by their attributes (errors, warnings, assets, optional, orphan, or dependent).
Tells stats whether to hide orphan modules. A module is an orphan if it is not included in any chunk. Orphan modules are hidden by default in stats.
Tells stats whether to output in the different colors.
Tells stats whether to show chunk modules that are dependencies of other modules of the chunk.
Tells stats whether to show stack trace of errors.
Tells stats whether to show the asset information. Set stats.assets to false to hide it.
Tells stats whether to show which exports of a module are used.
Tells clients connected to devServer to use provided socket host.
Tells clients connected to devServer to use provided socket port.
Tells dev-server to open the browser after server had been started. Set it to true to open your default browser.
Tells dev-server to suppress messages like the webpack bundle information. Errors and warnings will still be shown.
Tells dev-server to use serveIndex middleware when enabled.
Tells if result should be minimized.
Tells if source map should be generated. Since generating source maps can be an expensive task, you should check if source maps are actually requested.

Tells webpack to determine and flag chunks which are subsets of other chunks in a way that subsets don’t have to be loaded when the bigger chunk has been already loaded. By default optimization.flagIncludedChunks is enabled in productionmode and disabled elsewise.
trans-unit.target: Le dice a webpack que determine y marque fragmentos que son subconjuntos de otros fragmentos de manera que los subconjuntos no tengan que cargarse cuando el fragmento más grande ya se haya cargado. De forma predeterminada, optimization.flagIncludedChunks está habilitado en modo de production y deshabilitado en caso contrario.

trans-unit.source: Tells webpack to determine and flag chunks which are subsets of other chunks in a way that subsets don’t have to be loaded when the bigger chunk has been already loaded. By default optimization.flagIncludedChunks is enabled in productionmode and disabled elsewise.

Tells webpack to determine used exports for each module. This depends on optimization.providedExports. Information collected by optimization.usedExports is used by other optimizations or code generation i.e. exports are not generated for unused exports, export names are mangled to single char identifiers when all usages are compatible. Dead code elimination in minimizers will benefit from this and can remove unused exports. By default optimization.usedExports is enabled in productionmode and disabled elsewise.
trans-unit.target: Le dice a webpack que determine las exportaciones utilizadas para cada módulo. Esto depende de optimization.providedExports . La información recopilada por optimization.usedExports es utilizada por otras optimizaciones o generación de código, es decir, las exportaciones no se generan para las exportaciones no utilizadas, los nombres de las exportaciones se transforman en identificadores de un solo carácter cuando todos los usos son compatibles. La eliminación de códigos muertos en minimizadores se beneficiará de esto y puede eliminar las exportaciones no utilizadas. De forma predeterminada, optimization.usedExports está habilitado en modo de production y deshabilitado en caso contrario.

trans-unit.source: Tells webpack to determine used exports for each module. This depends on optimization.providedExports. Information collected by optimization.usedExports is used by other optimizations or code generation i.e. exports are not generated for unused exports, export names are mangled to single char identifiers when all usages are compatible. Dead code elimination in minimizers will benefit from this and can remove unused exports.

Tells webpack to determine used exports for each module. This depends on optimization.providedExports. Information collected by optimization.usedExports is used by other optimizations or code generation i.e. exports are not generated for unused exports, export names are mangled to single char identifiers when all usages are compatible. Dead code elimination in minimizers will benefit from this and can remove unused exports.
Tells webpack to enable cross-origin loading of chunks. Only takes effect when target is set to 'web', which uses JSONP for loading on-demand chunks, by adding script tags.
Tells webpack to figure out an order of modules which will result in the smallest initial bundle. By default optimization.occurrenceOrder is enabled in productionmode and disabled elsewise.
trans-unit.target: Le dice a webpack que averigüe un orden de módulos que resultará en el paquete inicial más pequeño. De forma predeterminada, optimization.occurrenceOrder está habilitado en modo de production y deshabilitado en caso contrario.

trans-unit.source: Tells webpack to figure out an order of modules which will result in the smallest initial bundle. By default optimization.occurrenceOrder is enabled in productionmode and disabled elsewise.
Tells webpack to figure out which exports are provided by modules to generate more efficient code for export * from .... By default optimization.providedExports is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Dice webpack Para averiguar qué exportaciones son proporcionados por módulos para generar un código más eficiente para export * from ... . De forma predeterminada, optimization.providedExports está habilitado.

trans-unit.source: Tells webpack to find segments of the module graph which can be safely concatenated into a single module. Depends on optimization.providedExports and optimization.usedExports. By default optimization.concatenateModules is enabled in productionmode and disabled elsewise.
trans-unit.target: Le dice a webpack que busque segmentos del gráfico del módulo que se puedan concatenar de forma segura en un solo módulo. Depende de optimization.providedExports y optimization.usedExports . De forma predeterminada, optimization.concatenateModules está habilitado en modo de production y deshabilitado en caso contrario.

trans-unit.source: Tells webpack to find segments of the module graph which can be safely concatenated into a single module. Depends on optimization.providedExports and optimization.usedExports. By default optimization.concatenateModules is enabled in productionmode and disabled elsewise.
Tells webpack to ignore splitChunks.minSize, splitChunks.minChunks, splitChunks.maxAsyncRequests and splitChunks.maxInitialRequests options and always create chunks for this cache group.

Tells webpack to ignore specific warnings. This can be done with a RegExp, a custom function to select warnings based on the raw warning instance which is getting WebpackError and Compilation as arguments and returns a boolean, an object with the following properties:
Tells webpack to include comments in bundles with information about the contained modules. This option defaults to true in development and false in productionmode respectively.

Tells webpack to include comments in bundles with information about the contained modules. This option defaults to true in development and false in productionmode respectively. 'verbose' shows more information like exports, runtime requirements and bailouts.
Tells webpack to merge chunks which contain the same modules. Setting optimization.mergeDuplicateChunks to false will disable this optimization.

trans-unit.target: Le dice a webpack que establezca process.env.NODE_ENV en un valor de cadena dado. optimization.nodeEnv usa DefinePlugin a menos que se establezca en false . optimization.nodeEnv por defecto a modo si se ha ajustado, lo demás cae de nuevo a "production" .

trans-unit.source: Tells webpack to use readable module identifiers for better debugging. When optimization.namedModules is not set in webpack config, webpack will enable it by default for modedevelopment and disable for modeproduction.

Cuando optimization.namedModules no está configurado en la configuración del paquete web, el paquete web lo habilitará de forma predeterminada para el development modo y lo desactivará para el modo de production .

trans-unit.source: The HtmlWebpackPlugin simplifies creation of HTML files to serve your webpack bundles. This is especially useful for webpack bundles that include a hash in the filename which changes every compilation. You can either let the plugin generate an HTML file for you, supply your own template using lodash templates, or use your own loader.
trans-unit.target: El HtmlWebpackPlugin creación simplifica de archivos HTML para servir a sus paquetes de WebPack. Esto es especialmente útil para paquetes de paquetes web que incluyen un hash en el nombre del archivo que cambia cada compilación. Puede dejar que el complemento genere un archivo HTML por usted, proporcionar su propia plantilla usando plantillas lodash o usar su propio cargador .

The mocha-webpack utility can be used for a clean integration with Mocha. The repository offers more details on the pros and cons but essentially mocha-webpack is a simple wrapper that provides almost the same CLI as Mocha itself and provides various webpack functionality like an improved watch mode and improved path resolution. Here is a small example of how you would install it and use it to run a test suite (found within ./test):
trans-unit.target: La utilidad mocha-webpack se puede utilizar para una integración limpia con Mocha. El repositorio ofrece más detalles sobre los pros y los contras, pero esencialmente mocha-webpack es un contenedor simple que proporciona casi la misma CLI que el propio Mocha y proporciona varias funciones de paquete web, como un modo de reloj mejorado y una resolución de ruta mejorada. Aquí hay un pequeño ejemplo de cómo lo instalaría y lo usaría para ejecutar un conjunto de pruebas (que se encuentra en ./test ):

trans-unit.source: The require.resolve call is a Node.js function (unrelated to require.resolve in webpack processing). require.resolve gives you the absolute path to the module ("/.../app/node_modules/react/react.js"). So the expose only applies to the react module. And it's only exposed when used in the bundle.
trans-unit.target: El require.resolve llamada es una función Node.js (no relacionada con require.resolve en el procesamiento webpack). require.resolve te da la ruta absoluta al módulo ( "/.../app/node_modules/react/react.js" ). Entonces, la exposición solo se aplica al módulo de reacción. Y solo está expuesto cuando se usa en el paquete.

trans-unit.source: The require.resolve call is a Node.js function (unrelated to require.resolve in webpack processing). require.resolve gives you the absolute path to the module ("/.../app/node_modules/jquery/dist/jquery.js"). So the expose only applies to the jquery module. And it's only exposed when used in the bundle.
The ES2015 Loader spec defines import() as method to load ES2015 modules dynamically on runtime.
trans-unit.target: La especificación del cargador ES2015 define import() como método para cargar módulos ES2015 dinámicamente en tiempo de ejecución.

trans-unit.source: The 'amd-require' target allows for the use of AMD dependencies without needing a separate later invocation. As with the 'amd' target, this depends on the appropriate require function being available in the environment in which the webpack output is loaded.
The 'commonjs ' + request defines the type of module that needs to be externalized.
trans-unit.target: La 'commonjs ' + request define el tipo de módulo que necesita ser externalizado.

trans-unit.source: The --json > compilation-stats.json flag indicates to webpack that it should emit the compilation-stats.json containing the dependency graph and various other build information. Typically, the --profile flag is also added so that a profile section is added to each modules object containing module-specific compilation stats.
trans-unit.target: El --json > compilation-stats.json indica al paquete web que debe emitir compilation-stats.json que contiene el gráfico de dependencia y otra información de compilación. Típicamente, el --profile también se añade la bandera de modo que un profile se añade a la sección de cada uno de modules a objetos que contiene las estadísticas de compilación módulo-específicos.

trans-unit.source: The --json=compilation-stats.json flag indicates to webpack that it should emit the compilation-stats.json containing the dependency graph and various other build information. Typically, the --profile flag is also added so that a profile section is added to each modules object containing module-specific compilation stats.
The --profile option captures timing information for each step of the compilation and includes this in the output.
trans-unit.target: La opción --profile captura información de tiempo para cada paso de la compilación y la incluye en la salida.

trans-unit.source: The AutomaticPrefetchPlugin discovers all modules from the previous compilation upfront while watching for changes, trying to improve the incremental build times. Compared to PrefetchPlugin which discovers a single module upfront.
trans-unit.target: El AutomaticPrefetchPlugin descubre todos los módulos de la anterior por adelantado compilación mientras ve los cambios, tratando de mejorar los tiempos de construcción incrementales. Comparado con PrefetchPlugin que descubre un solo módulo por adelantado.

trans-unit.source: The CommonsChunkPlugin is an opt-in feature that creates a separate file (known as a chunk), consisting of common modules shared between multiple entry points.
trans-unit.target: El CommonsChunkPlugin es una característica opcional que crea un archivo independiente (conocido como un trozo), que consiste en módulos comunes compartidos entre múltiples puntos de entrada.

trans-unit.source: The Compilation class also extends Tapable and provides the following lifecycle hooks. They can be tapped the same way as compiler hooks:
trans-unit.target: La clase Compilation también amplía Tapable y proporciona los siguientes enlaces de ciclo de vida. Se pueden aprovechar de la misma manera que los ganchos del compilador:

trans-unit.source: The Compilation module is used by the Compiler to create new compilations (or builds). A compilation instance has access to all modules and their dependencies (most of which are circular references). It is the literal compilation of all the modules in the dependency graph of an application. During the compilation phase, modules are loaded, sealed, optimized, chunked, hashed and restored.
trans-unit.target: El Compiler utiliza el módulo Compilation para crear nuevas compilaciones (o compilaciones). Una instancia de compilation tiene acceso a todos los módulos y sus dependencias (la mayoría de las cuales son referencias circulares). Es la compilación literal de todos los módulos en el gráfico de dependencia de una aplicación. Durante la fase de compilación, los módulos se cargan, sellan, optimizan, fragmentan, procesan y restauran.

trans-unit.source: The Compiler module is the main engine that creates a compilation instance with all the options passed through the CLI or Node API. It extends the Tapable class in order to register and call plugins. Most user facing plugins are first registered on the Compiler.
trans-unit.target: El módulo Compiler es el motor principal que crea una instancia de compilación con todas las opciones pasadas a través de la CLI o API de nodo . Extiende la clase Tapable para registrar y llamar complementos. La mayoría de los complementos para usuarios se registran primero en el Compiler .

trans-unit.source: The Compiler supports watching which monitors the file system and recompiles as files change. When in watch mode, the compiler will emit the additional events such as watchRun, watchClose, and invalid. This is typically used in development, usually under the hood of tools like webpack-dev-server, so that the developer doesn't need to re-compile manually every time. Watch mode can also be entered via the CLI.
trans-unit.target: El Compiler admite la observación, que supervisa el sistema de archivos y vuelve a compilar a medida que cambian los archivos. Cuando está en modo reloj, el compilador emitirá eventos adicionales como watchRun , watchClose e invalid . Esto se usa generalmente en el desarrollo , generalmente bajo el capó de herramientas como webpack-dev-server , de modo que el desarrollador no necesita volver a compilar manualmente cada vez. El modo reloj también se puede ingresar a través de la CLI .

trans-unit.source: The ContextExclusionPlugin allows you to exclude context. Provide RegExp as an argument when initializing the Plugin to exclude all context that matches it.
The ContextModuleFactory class extends Tapable and provides the following lifecycle hooks. They can be tapped the same way as compiler hooks:

The ContextModuleFactory module is used by the Compiler to generate dependencies from webpack specific require.context API. It resolves the requested directory, generates requests for each file and filters against passed regExp. Matching dependencies then passes through NormalModuleFactory.
The ContextReplacementPlugin allows you to override the inferred information. There are various ways to configure the plugin:
trans-unit.target: El ContextReplacementPlugin le permite anular la información inferida. Hay varias formas de configurar el complemento:

trans-unit.source: The DefinePlugin allows you to create global constants which can be configured at compile time. This can be useful for allowing different behavior between development builds and production builds. If you perform logging in your development build but not in the production build you might use a global constant to determine whether logging takes place. That's where DefinePlugin shines, set it and forget it rules for development and production builds.

The DefinePlugin allows you to create global constants which can be configured at compile time. This can be useful for allowing different behavior between development builds and release builds. If you perform logging in your development build but not in the release build you might use a global constant to determine whether logging takes place. That's where DefinePlugin shines, set it and forget it rules for development and release builds.
trans-unit.target: El DefinePlugin le permite crear constantes globales que se pueden configurar en la compilación tiempo. Esto puede resultar útil para permitir un comportamiento diferente entre versiones de desarrollo y versiones de lanzamiento. Si realiza el registro en su compilación de desarrollo pero no en la compilación de lanzamiento, puede usar una constante global para determinar si se realiza el registro. Ahí es donde DefinePlugin brilla, configúrelo y olvídese de las reglas para el desarrollo y la publicación de compilaciones.

trans-unit.source: The DllPlugin and DllReferencePlugin provide means to split bundles in a way that can drastically improve build time performance.
trans-unit.target: El DllPlugin y DllReferencePlugin proporcionan medios para haces hendidos en una forma que puede mejorar drásticamente el rendimiento del tiempo de construcción.

trans-unit.source: The DllPlugin and DllReferencePlugin provide means to split bundles in a way that can drastically improve build time performance. The term "DLL" stands for Dynamic-link library which was originally introduced by Microsoft.
The EnvironmentPlugin accepts either an array of keys or an object mapping its keys to their default values.
trans-unit.target: El EnvironmentPlugin acepta una matriz de claves o un objeto que asigna sus claves a sus valores predeterminados.

trans-unit.source: The EnvironmentPlugin is shorthand for using the DefinePlugin on process.env keys.
trans-unit.target: El EnvironmentPlugin es la abreviatura para el uso de la DefinePlugin en process.env llaves.

trans-unit.source: The LoaderOptionsPlugin is unlike other plugins in that it is built for migration from webpack 1 to 2. In webpack 2, the schema for a webpack.config.js became stricter; no longer open for extension by other loaders and plugins. The intention is that you pass options directly to loaders and plugins (i.e. options are not global or shared).
trans-unit.target: El LoaderOptionsPlugin es a diferencia de otros plugins en que se construye para la migración de webpack 1 a 2. En webpack 2, el esquema para un webpack.config.js hizo más estricta; ya no está abierto para extensión por otros cargadores y complementos. La intención es que pase las options directamente a los cargadores y complementos (es decir, las options no son globales ni compartidas).

trans-unit.source: The MultiCompiler module allows webpack to run multiple configurations in separate compilers. If the options parameter in the webpack's NodeJS api is an array of options, webpack applies separate compilers and calls the callback after all compilers have been executed.

The MultiCompiler module allows webpack to run multiple configurations in separate compilers. If the options parameter in the webpack's NodeJS api is an array of options, webpack applies separate compilers and calls the callback method at the end of each compiler execution.
trans-unit.target: El módulo MultiCompiler permite que webpack ejecute múltiples configuraciones en compiladores separados. Si el parámetro de options en la api de NodeJS del paquete web es una matriz de opciones, el paquete web aplica compiladores separados y llama al método de callback al final de la ejecución de cada compilador.

trans-unit.source: The NoEmitOnErrorsPlugin allows you to avoid emitting assets when there are any errors. Enabled by default, you can disable using optimization.emitOnErrors
The NormalModuleFactory class extends Tapable and provides the following lifecycle hooks. They can be tapped the same way as compiler hooks:

The NormalModuleFactory module is used by the Compiler to generate modules. Starting with entry points, it resolves each request, parses the content to find further requests, and keeps crawling through files by resolving all and parsing any new files. At last stage, each dependency becomes a Module instance.

The NormalModuleReplacementPlugin allows you to replace resources that match resourceRegExp with newResource. If newResource is relative, it is resolved relative to the previous resource. If newResource is a function, it is expected to overwrite the request attribute of the supplied resource.
trans-unit.target: El NormalModuleReplacementPlugin le permite reemplazar recursos que coinciden con resourceRegExp con newResource . Si newResource es relativo, se resuelve en relación con el recurso anterior. Si newResource es una función, se espera que sobrescriba el atributo de solicitud del recurso proporcionado.

trans-unit.source: The ProgressPlugin is used to customize how progress should be reported during compilation, and HtmlWebpackPlugin will generate a HTML file including the my-first-webpack.bundle.js file using a script tag.
The ProgressPlugin provides a way to customize how progress is reported during a compilation.
The [local] placeholder contains original class.
The [name], [id], [fullhash] and [chunkhash] substitutions from output.filename can be used. In addition to those, you can use substitutions listed under Filename-level in Template strings.

The [name], [id], [hash] and [chunkhash] substitutions from #output-filename can be used. In addition to those, you can use substitutions listed below. The [file] placeholder is replaced with the filename of the original file. We recommend only using the [file] placeholder, as the other placeholders won't work when generating SourceMaps for non-chunk files.
trans-unit.target: Se pueden usar las sustituciones de [name] , [id] , [hash] y [chunkhash] de # output-filename . Además de esos, puede utilizar las sustituciones que se enumeran a continuación. El marcador de posición [file] se reemplaza con el nombre de archivo del archivo original. Recomendamos usar solo el marcador de posición [file] , ya que los otros marcadores de posición no funcionarán al generar SourceMaps para archivos que no sean fragmentos.

trans-unit.source: The app chunk will not contain the modules that react-vendors has.

The apply method flags all updated modules as invalid. For each invalid module, there needs to be an update handler in the module or in its parent(s). Otherwise, the invalid flag bubbles up and invalidates parent(s) as well. Each bubble continues until the app's entry point or a module with an update handler is reached (whichever comes first). If it bubbles up from an entry point, the process fails.
trans-unit.target: El método de apply marca todos los módulos actualizados como no válidos. Para cada módulo no válido, debe haber un controlador de actualización en el módulo o en sus padres. De lo contrario, el indicador no válido aparece e invalida a los padres también. Cada burbuja continúa hasta que se alcanza el punto de entrada de la aplicación o un módulo con un controlador de actualización (lo que ocurra primero). Si brota de un punto de entrada, el proceso falla.

trans-unit.source: The autoApply parameter can either be a boolean or options to pass to the apply method when called.
trans-unit.target: El parámetro autoApply puede ser un booleano u options para pasar al método de apply cuando se llama.

trans-unit.target: El objeto err no incluirá errores de compilación y estos deben manejarse por separado usando stats.hasErrors() que se tratarán en detalle en la sección Manejo de errores de esta guía. The errorHandler is fired when the evaluation of this module (or dependencies) has thrown an exception.
trans-unit.target: El errorHandler se activa cuando la evaluación de este módulo (o dependencias) ha generado una excepción.

trans-unit.source: The export keyword allows to expose things from an ESM to other modules:

The exports field in the package.json of a package allows to declare which module should be used when using module requests like import "package" or import "package/sub/path". It replaces the default implementation that returns main field resp. index.js files for "package" and the file system lookup for "package/sub/path".
The expose-loader loader allows to expose a module (in whole or in part) to global object (self, window and global).
The extends property also supports naming installed NPM modules which export webpack configurations. Various configuration properties can also be filtered in different ways based on need.

trans-unit.source: The externals configuration option provides a way of excluding dependencies from the output bundles. Instead, the created bundle relies on that dependency to be present in the consumer's (any end-user application) environment. This feature is typically most useful to library developers, however there are a variety of applications for it.

The externals configuration option provides a way of excluding dependencies from the output bundles. Instead, the created bundle relies on that dependency to be present in the consumer's environment. This feature is typically most useful to library developers, however there are a variety of applications for it.
trans-unit.target: La opción de configuración externals proporciona una forma de excluir dependencias de los paquetes de salida. En cambio, el paquete creado depende de que esa dependencia esté presente en el entorno del consumidor. Esta característica suele ser más útil para los desarrolladores de bibliotecas , sin embargo, hay una variedad de aplicaciones para ella.

The import() must contain at least some information about where the module is located. Bundling can be limited to a specific directory or set of files so that when you are using a dynamic expression - every module that could potentially be requested on an import() call is included. For example, import(`./locale/${language}.json`) will cause every .json file in the ./locale directory to be bundled into the new chunk. At run time, when the variable language has been computed, any file like english.json or german.json will be available for consumption.

trans-unit.source: The module condition is used as optimization when preprocessing node-targeted code with a tool that supports ESM for require() (like a bundler, when bundling for Node.js). For such a tool the exception is skipped. This is technically optional, but bundlers would include the package source code twice otherwise.

The module handles class and id scoping and @value values. The icss will only compile the low level Interoperable CSS format for declaring :import and :export dependencies between CSS and other languages.

The module property should point to a script that utilizes ES2015 module syntax but no other syntax features that aren't yet supported by browsers or node. This enables webpack to parse the module syntax itself, allowing for lighter bundles via tree shaking if users are only consuming certain parts of the library.
trans-unit.target: La propiedad del module debe apuntar a un script que utilice la sintaxis del módulo ES2015, pero no otras características de sintaxis que aún no sean compatibles con los navegadores o el nodo. Esto permite que el paquete web analice la sintaxis del módulo en sí, lo que permite paquetes más ligeros mediante la agitación de árboles si los usuarios solo consumen ciertas partes de la biblioteca.

trans-unit.source: The sass-loader uses Sass's custom importer feature to pass all queries to the Webpack resolving engine. Thus you can import your Sass modules from node_modules.

The sass-loader uses Sass's custom importer feature to pass all queries to the Webpack resolving engine. Thus you can import your Sass modules from node_modules. Just prepend them with a ~ to tell Webpack that this is not a relative import:

The source-map-loader extracts existing source maps from all JavaScript entries. This includes both inline source maps as well as those linked via URL. All source map data is passed to webpack for processing as per a chosen source map style specified by the devtool option in webpack.config.js. This loader is especially useful when using 3rd-party libraries having their own source maps. If not extracted and processed into the source map of the webpack bundle, browsers may misinterpret source map data. source-map-loader allows webpack to maintain source map data continuity across libraries so ease of debugging is preserved. The source-map-loader will extract from any JavaScript file, including those in the node_modules directory. Be mindful in setting include and exclude rule conditions to maximize bundling performance.

trans-unit.source: The webpack compiler can understand modules written as ES2015 modules, CommonJS or AMD. However, some third party libraries may expect global dependencies (e.g. $ for jQuery). Estos "módulos rotos" son una instancia en la que entra en juego el ajuste .

trans-unit.source: The API only supports a single concurrent compilation at a time. When using run, wait for it to finish before calling run or watch again. When using watch, call close and wait for it to finish before calling run or watch again. Concurrent compilations will corrupt the output files.
trans-unit.target: La API solo admite una única compilación simultánea a la vez. Cuando utilice run , espere a que termine antes de volver a llamar a run o watch . Cuando use el watch , llame al close y espere a que termine antes de llamar a run o watch nuevamente. Las compilaciones simultáneas dañarán los archivos de salida.

The Node.js API is useful in scenarios in which you need to customize the build or development process since all the reporting and error handling must be done manually and webpack only does the compiling part. For this reason the stats configuration options will not have any effect in the webpack() call.

Por esta razón, las opciones de configuración de stats no tendrán ningún efecto en la llamada a webpack() .
